newsitem.title: FRANCE: Russia to disarm missiles pointed at NATO -Yeltsin.
newsitem.headline: Russia to disarm missiles pointed at NATO -Yeltsin.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin, in a surprise announcement at a NATO-Russia summit, said on Tuesday that Moscow would disarm all missiles targeted at NATO countries.
"I have taken a decision today. Everything that is aimed at countries present here, all of those weapons, are going to have their warheads removed," Yeltsin said.

Yeltsin stood up and made the statement in an impromptu intervention in the summit after signing the "Founding Act" of a new partnership for security in Europe with leaders of the 16-nation Atlantic alliance.
The apparent decision to disarm the former Soviet nuclear arsenal targeted at the West came as a surprise and was greeted with warm applause.
The United States and Russia agreed at a summit in Moscow in 1993 no longer to target each other's cities, but Yeltsin's announcement appeared to go far beyond that commitment.
